title: "Impact of mass drug administration campaigns depends on interaction with seasonal human movement"
author: 
  - Jaline Gerardin
  - Amelia Bertozzi-Villa
  - Philip A. Eckhoff
  - Edward A. Wenger
journal name: "International Health"
subtitle: "International Health"
date: 2018-04-09
doi: https://doi.org/10.1093/inthealth/ihy025
abstract: "A mathematical model was used to simulate malaria transmission in two villages connected to a high-risk area into and out of which 10% of villagers traveled seasonally. MDA was given only in the villages. Prevalence reduction under various possible timings of MDA and seasonal travel was predicted."
category: Drug Campaigns
type: Modeling Study
